Issues.Title: When executing PSADT package as NT\LOCALSYTEM (default behavior when we deploy the packages inside SCCM), no text is read by the screen reader.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET version: 6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

We are using a customized version of PSAppDeployToolkit to create software packages for SCCM. This powershell templating tool can display different popups to the user. We detected two different behaviors of screen readers :
 When executing PSADT package as user the text popup is correctly processed by the screen readers software
 When executing PSADT package as NT\LOCALSYTEM (default behavior when we deploy the packages inside SCCM), no text is read.

Note: PSAppDeployToolkit team concluded that the issue is with WinForms, not with the PSADT. Please refer: https://github.com/PSAppDeployToolkit/PSAppDeployToolkit/issues/702

### Steps to reproduce

The Full way : (see below for the short version)

Download PsAppDeployToolkit 3.8.4 (https://github.com/PSAppDeployToolkit/PSAppDeployToolkit/releases)

Extract the “Toolkit” Folder and use cmdlet Unblock-File . in the “Toolkit” and in the “\AppDeployToolkit“ folders to allow further scripts execution

Open “Deploy-Application.ps1” with a text editor

Line 120, replace the whole line by:
Show-InstallationWelcome -CloseApps 'iexplore,msedge' -AllowDefer -DeferTimes 99 -CheckDiskSpace -PersistPrompt

Start Microsoft Edge

Start the Windows Narrator

Right click on deploy-application.exe and “Execute as Administrator”

After a moment, a pop-up is displayed in the OS language:
<image 1>

The inner text and title are read partially => This is the expected behavior

Click on “Close Program” and the pop-up will close and Microsoft Edge will close.

Open the Edge.

Download the Sysinternal https://download.sysinternals.com/files/SysinternalsSuite.zip

Unzip the downloaded file.

Copy the PSEXEC.EXE tool from the Sysinternal folder and paste it in the same folder as Deploy-application.exe exist

Open a command prompt as administrator :

Run command :
"Full\Path\To\Tookit\ psexec.exe present in the Toolkit folder” -i -s "Full\Path\To\Tookit\Deploy-Application.exe"

This will execute the same file but as NT\LocalSystem with interactive session

After a while, the same pop-up appears :
<image 2>

This time no text is correctly read by the Windows Narrator => We are in this context in our SCCM deployments and we want to have a proper reading of the popup in this context.

The Short way :

Create a powershell test file called… test.ps1
Add :
[void][System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadWithPartialName("System.Windows.Forms")
$form = New-Object Windows.Forms.Form
$form.FormBorderStyle = [System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle]::FixedDialog
$form.MaximizeBox = $False
$form.MinimizeBox = $False

$form.Text = "Hello world..."
$form.Size = New-Object System.Drawing.Size(400,370)

$label_prez = New-Object System.Windows.Forms.Label
$label_prez.Location = New-Object System.Drawing.Point(20,20)
$label_prez.Size = New-Object System.Drawing.Size(100,20)
$label_prez.Text = "I am a label"

$button_quit = New-Object System.Windows.Forms.Button
$button_quit.Text = "Close"
$button_quit.Size = New-Object System.Drawing.Size(355,40)
$button_quit.Location = New-Object System.Drawing.Size(20,280)
$button_quit.Add_Click(
{
$form.Close();
})
image 2
image 1

$form.AccessibleRole = [Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole]::Dialog
$label_prez.AccessibleRole = [Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole]::StaticText
$form.Controls.Add($label_prez)
$form.Controls.Add($button_quit)
$form.ShowDialog()

Save
Execute with: powershell.exe -file test.ps1
The pop-up is correctly read by Windows Narrator
Start it as localsystem with : psexec.exe -i -s powershell.exe “Full\Path\to\test.ps1”
The pop-up is not read by Windows Narrator
Expected Results:
When executed as localsystem, the pop-up should be correctly read by screen readers

Current Results:
Pop-up content is not read. (the demo involves the Windows Narrator, but we get the same result with NVDA)

Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

Toolkit Version:
PSAppDeployToolkit 3.8.4

Powershell Version:
Version of Powershell you are using to run the toolkit. For example: 5.1

Additional context
We provided two ways of testing the behavior of a Powershell WinForms Window, the first involves PSADT and is closer of what we get, the second is just a plain Winforms window without PSADT (so you can see that the behavior is not related to a PSADT bug)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When executing PSADT package as NT\LOCALSYTEM (default behavior when we deploy the packages inside SCCM), no text is read by the screen reader." (#7658)

Issues.Title: added support of C#11 to templates
Issues.Body:
## Problem
In the templates, the generators which determine minimum language version in use were not considering C#11. 
Fixed regex to support it.

## Customer impact 
Without this fix, using C# 11.0 via `--langVersion` option will result in old style template (no top level statements, file scoped namespaces, implicit usings)

## Testing
Automated

## Risk
Very low. 
Language version option is only available in CLI and not exposed in Visual Studio.

Issues.Title: microsoft.dotnet.designtools.client.proxies.ControlProxy not available
Issues.Body:
### Environment

VS 2022 Version 17.4.0 Preview 1.0
windows 11, 64bit


### .NET version

since it's a VS extension, it targets Framework 4.8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

sure, in VS2019 it's been working (i don't remember when the switch to the new oop designer happened, but _that_ is the relevant breaking point.

### Issue description

i'm trying to migrate a VS extension to VS2022 that is using DTE to get to the currently selected control in the winforms designer, and toggles through its Dock property, so that a control can be snapped to the sides of its parent via hotkey.

in VS2022, the out of process designer is being used, and the object that is selected (that DTE / ISelectionService returns) is an
microsoft.dotnet.designtools.client.proxies.ControlProxy<T>

i cannot find this type. is it not publicly visible? are there interfaces i could cast it to?
basically, i need to get to the underlying control to set its dock property.

Any help is greatly appreciated.


### Steps to reproduce

i can put the extension project onto github and make it publicly available, if requested.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "microsoft.dotnet.designtools.client.proxies.ControlProxy not available" (#7657)

Issues.Title: I am seeing lots of churn (via GitHub) when anything in Designer changes related to DataGridView
Issues.Body:
### Environment

All

### .NET version

All

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No

### Issue description

This is a tracking issue; it worked this way in Framework, but it really threshes GitHub

These changes happen constantly they don't break anything they just renumber CellStyles
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12789369/186293208-f30b64ce-ec03-4f72-bbd9-8a45e5a8cd31.png)
The next change restores the original values
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12789369/186295137-67025389-91be-4647-bcb6-140b07c83cd4.png)

_Originally posted by @paul1956 in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7602#issuecomment-1225044377_

Changing anything in a WinForms Form when the Designer file is recreated. You will see large changes if you use Git to compare current with history. An example is shown in the image above. This is just 1 example.

### Steps to reproduce

Create a Form, add a DateGridView and something else like a TextBox, save Push, to GitHub, Open Form in Designer change anything like move textbox. and then use Git to do a Diff and you will see the difference shown above.

### Diagnostics

```text
N/A
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I am seeing lots of churn (via GitHub) when anything in Designer changes related to DataGridView" (#7653)

Issues.Body:
- Converted `SHCreateShellItem`, `SHGetPathFromIDListLongPath` and `SHBrowseForFolderW`.
- Converted `BrowseInfoFlags` to CsWin32 `BIF_*`
- Added `IShellItem = Interop.Shell32.IShellItem`, `Shell = Windows.Win32.UI.Shell` and `SIGDN = Interop.Shell32.SIGDN` to resolve ambigous usings.
